title: 110_hr6943
content: SECTION 1. ALGAE DERIVED FUEL CREDIT. Subpart D of part IV of subchapter A of chapter 1 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by inserting section 40B for Algae Derived Fuel Credit. The Algae Derived Fuel Credit allows a taxpayer to claim a credit of $1.50 for each gallon of algae-derived fuel produced and sold for use as fuel or used in a trade or business. The credit is also applicable if the fuel is used in a mixture with another fuel and sold for use as fuel or used in a trade or business. The credit amount is reduced if any other benefits are received under section 6426 or 6427(e) for the same algae-derived fuel. The Algae Derived Fuel Credit defines algae derived fuel as a liquid hydrocarbon product derived from algal organisms, excluding fuels eligible for credits under other sections. Algal organisms are photosynthetic aquatic organisms. Rules similar to section 40A(d) apply if the fuel is not used as intended. The credit expires after December 31, 2012. The biodiesel fuels credit and algae derived fuels credit are added to the general business credit under the tax code. The algae derived fuels credit applies to liquid hydrocarbon products derived from algal organisms and expires after December 31, 2012. The tax code is amended to include the algae derived fuels credit under section 40B(a). A clerical amendment is made to the table of sections for subpart D of part IV of subchapter A of chapter 1. The tax code is amended to include a new algae derived fuel credit under section 40B. The effective date for the amendments is for fuels sold or used in taxable years beginning after the enactment of the Act. Additionally, there is an excise tax credit parity for algae derived fuel outlined in section 2. The tax code is amended to include a new algae derived fuel mixture credit under section 6426. This credit allows for a $1.50 credit per gallon of algae derived fuel produced and sold at retail or used in a taxpayer's trade or business. The tax code is amended to include a new algae derived fuel mixture credit under section 6426, providing a $1.50 credit per gallon of algae derived fuel used in a taxpayer's trade or business. The amendments apply to fuels sold or used after the enactment of this Act, with a termination date set for sales or use after December 31, 2012. SEC. 3. Parity regarding payments for fuel mixture. Section 3 of the document addresses parity in payments for fuel mixtures. It includes amendments to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 related to alternative fuel mixture credits, termination dates for certain fuel mixtures, and a new credit for algae-based fuel mixtures sold or used after December 31, 2012. The effective date for these amendments is after the enactment of the Act.
